entry.title: HAIL MARY
entry.summary:
Author: sleepyteatimebear

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,202Chapters: 2/32Kudos: 15

Summary: Clark 'Superman' Kent, is a shoe-in for the NFL draft, a tall, dimpled, All-American-Type, College Football's Jesus. Bruce is well-known for his intense dedication to collegiate journalism, his all-black closet and the billions promised to him upon graduation. Bruce wants to sweep at the Collegiate Emmy's, Clark wants to go pro. So, they make a deal. Bruce can produce a media campaign that rallies the public behind Clark before Draft Day. Bruce helps to upkeep the Wayne Media Enterprise legacy, and Clark gets good press. But then, Clark and Bruce spend game-day after game-day together. Bruce asks Clark questions, studies him, captures him, writes all of him down. What's even more peculiar is Clark starts asking questions back. Questions that make Bruce feel like Clark wants to know him as more than just his shadow for the season. They can’t fall in love. It wouldn’t make practical sense. It wouldn’t make emotional sense. But couldn't it?

entry.title: Everybody knows
entry.summary:
Author: LukeWinssmett

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,229Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 33

Summary: He will destroy something.Something precious to Lex, something important, something that has taken him months of study, preparation and financing. He doesn't care what it is.He'll break it.And he'll feel good.He goes straight to the workshop.Everything works as usual... except for that corridor. The west corridor.He has never been here before. In fact, he hardly ever stays in the building beyond sleeping there, and even that doesn't last long. He is at school, he sleeps in hotels, his father hardly ever wants him here. Strange.He stops because of something intriguing. Then he sees it. The room looks like a cell.It's... a room. Too clean. Too white. A simulation of comfort. Yet, enclosed in a kind of glass box, too big to hold a bed and a few basic things: it's a complete room with a metal door.And in the centre, sitting in a simple chair, is a man.At first, Conner thinks he is an employee. A technician. Someone who angered his father enough to end up locked up.Then the man raises his head.His eyes — blue, intense — open with a mixture of surprise and something more dangerous.Recognition."Kon-El"

entry.title: Put my heart on the line, but it never seems to work
entry.summary:
Author: Speechless_since_1998

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,398Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 157

Summary: Bruce had the blood of his children on his hands, and he could never do enough. He wasn't good enough. So, he didn't answer. What was the point of arguing? But then, seeing that he wasn't reacting, Dick resolved to deal with things as usual, and prepared to strike. But the punch never landed. Superman had blocked Nightwing's wrist, eyes glowing red "Your brother's not going to get better by blaming him," the alien said, calmly, in contrast to Dick's stormy exterior. "Especially when it's not Batman's fault."   (After an alien invasion, Nightwing blames Batman for Red Robin's injuries. Superman isn't a fan of his friend's family's way of dealing with their problems.)

entry.title: Take a chance on me
entry.summary:
Author: Panickymouse29

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 66,590Chapters: 40/?Kudos: 31

Summary: Aileen Allen was recruited into the Avatar Program at twenty-two after drawing RDA attention for her effectiveness in close-quarters security operations where escalation repeatedly failed. She wasn’t chosen for aggression, but for control—she ended threats quickly and quietly in environments where firearms were a liability. The RDA classified her as difficult: independent, resistant to rigid command, and openly critical of excessive force. Those traits would normally have ended her candidacy. Dr. Grace Augustine intervened, citing Aileen’s adaptability and restraint as exactly what the program lacked. On Pandora, Aileen immediately modified her uniform for mobility and heat, ignoring protocol in favour of survival. She demonstrated an unusual tendency to de-escalate Na’vi encounters rather than provoke them, earning Grace’s quiet approval—and RDA’s suspicion. By the time Jake Sully arrived, Aileen was already operating on the fringe of RDA control: respected by the scientists, tolerated by command, and trusted by Grace to act when others would make things worse.Pandora didn’t recruit Aileen Allen. Grace Augustine did.

entry.title: What Cannot Be Seen From Sight.
entry.summary:
Author: DelusionalBookWorm

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,890Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 7

Summary: "And then Clark had realized something. The first layer of the gallery was Brucie Wayne. Roses, cedarwood, and expensive refreshers. A man who only lets on so much for the sake of his public image. The second layer of him was The Bat. Kelvar, ozone, and Gotham's dirtied rain. A symbol of unfaltering justice for those who need it. And the third.. the third layer of the mask was Bruce. Just Bruce. A person whose tragedy had shaped him into the man that he was today, a man who locks his emotions into a vault because he views them as weaknesses. A man who is afraid of being found.." After the disastrous incident in space, the world's symbol of hope loses his sight of the world, a dawn no longer bright to him. He must navigate through the darkness with one of his fellow Justice League members, Bruce Wayne and grasp his way back into the light. But there is always another hidden layer to things, and as the facades stip away, The Man Of Steel and The Caped Crusader find themselves anchoring each other more than they'd ever realize.

entry.title: The Company We Keep
entry.summary:
Author: WrenA

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,864Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 46

Summary: They say you can tell a person by the company they keep and all Barry could say about Superman was that he was far from the goodie-two-shoes everyone made him out to be initially. If you were to go by said company:- The colleagues at the Daily Planet and especially Lois and Jimmy- Clark's parents who always send sweets- Clark's close friend, Thomas, who sports a permanent stubble, disheveled hair and dark circles under the eyes- The mysterious 'B' who Superman sometimes calls to call in a favor when something requires a more tricky investigation- Nightwing, who is part of the league but acts incredibly familiar to Supes- An assortment of friends that he keeps mentioning- A (possible) crime lord whose file keeps getting deleted from the Watchtower databases- An array of vigilantes that absolutely refuse to join the league and have an unhealthy obsession for bats- THE BATMAN!? THE BATMAN IS REAL and does Superman know BATMAN!?- Lex Luthor, a homicidal billionaire- Bruce Wayne, not a homicidal billionaire, just annoying- Superman's kids?!? Or glimpses into the life of Superman over time, as seen through the eyes of one Barry Allen.

entry.title: Dark Days and Lost Suns
entry.summary:
Author: Athena_Faymont

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 159,791Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 147

Summary: Clark admires Batman, the man who has given up civilian life to protect everyone else's, the tough, sharp, and compassionate man. Bruce admires Superman, the alien who, despite being able to dominate them all by force, has decided to take care of a planet that isn't his own.And, even with these two flawed principles, neither of them can imagine how alone the other feels... and how alone they themselves are. This is a long story, the superbat fanfic I've always wanted to write about how, within the canon, one day something changes and they find each other. If you want to join me on this adventure, we'll be here every Friday. [Puedes encontrarlo en español en mi perfil.]

Author: snapdragonsuplex

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 92,059Chapters: 21/23Kudos: 611

Summary: Eight months after Lex Luthor nearly ripped the world apart- two months after he and Lois called it quits- Clark finds his attention taken up by a mysterious billionaire, as well as an investigation into Gotham mayor Harvey Dent.
